content.description: A juggy line with dynamic moves on orange granite with two bulges to climb through.

This route climbs the upper right side of Post Modern wall to the summit. Head up the low angle scrambly start to the wall and climb straight up the central portion cliping bolts as you enjoy the features.
content.location: The start of the route is located directly above Seam-iotics. But you can approach from the summit and rap the route if you only want to climb this route.

content.description:
This two pitch route is a hidden gem of Banks lake with a little of everything including a long sustained finger crack, and an akwardly sized chimney.

Pitch 1 5.8+ Climb the broken cracks and features up to the off body sized chimney then up through the chimney to the opening at the top. Belay bolts on the left side of the chimney. ~35-40M

Pitch 2 5.9 Climb the striking 60 foot long finger crack straight up past the bulge to the chains. Sustained 5.9 pitch with a short section of flaring offwidth.

Finish up on Sky's the Limit to reach the summit or rap the route to the left.
content.protection: Single rack with gear to 3" and doubles in the small finger to finger range. Optional larger pieces can be placed in the begining of the first pitch. Some bolts as well.
content.location: This route is located on the lower right side of the wall. It can be located by the prominent deep chimney system of the first pitch on the lower right hand side of the wall.

content.description: Begin below the pedestal and step up to the granite face.  Follow the bolts along the right edge of the wall to the anchors.

Make a thin, bouldery start to a bolt and then to a small ledge. From the ledge, step left onto the face of white granite and climb 60 ft of beautiful granite.

Optional: past the anchors, there is another 25 ft of climbing past one bolt to another set of bolted anchors
content.location: 2nd route on the wall when approached from the south
